alert.note: Alert for Hampden; Hampshire; Middlesex; Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 10:29AM EDT until July 10 at 10:28PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northern Connecticut, including the following counties, Tolland and Windham. Portions of Massachusetts, including the following counties, Hampden, Hampshire, Middlesex and Worcester. Portions of Rhode Island, including the following counties, Kent, Providence and Washington. * WHEN...Until 200 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1027 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Worcester, Cranston, Shrewsbury, Coventry, Johnston, Mansfield, Windham, Plainfield, Smithfield, Westborough, Grafton, Willimantic, Killingly, Webster, Southbridge, Auburn, Burrillville, Northbridge, Hopkinton and Oxford. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
